glimg package¶

Submodules¶

glimg.detbbox module¶

glimg.detbbox.bbox_intersection(bbox1, bbox2)[source]¶

return the intersection area of two bboxes

param
bbox1: bounding represented by a list: [xmin,ymin,xmax,ymax] bbox2: bounding with the same representation as bbox1
return
intersection: the intersection area of bbox1 and bbox2
glimg.detbbox.bbox_iou(bbox1, bbox2, xywh=False)[source]¶

return the IOU (Intersection Over Union) of two bboxes

param
bbox1: bounding represented by a list: [xmin,ymin,xmax,ymax] bbox2: bounding with the same representation as bbox1 xywh: flag indicates if bboxes are represented by [x,y,w,h] format
return
intersection: the intersection area of bbox1 and bbox2
glimg.detbbox.bbox_union(bbox1, bbox2)[source]¶

return the union area of two bboxes.

param
bbox1: bounding represented by a list: [xmin,ymin,xmax,ymax] bbox2: bounding with the same representation as bbox1
return
bbox_union: the union area of bbox1 and bbox2
glimg.detbbox.global_corners(dims, ry, locat)[source]¶

given the dimension, yaw angle and object location, calculate the 3D world coordinates of 3D BBox eight corners.

param:
dims: object dimension represented by [h,w,l] ry: object yaw angle (rad) locat: object location in world coordinate system (usually the camera coordinate system), represented as [x,y,z]
Returns:numpy array of 3D coordinates with shape (3*8)
glimg.detbbox.local_corners(dims, ry)[source]¶

given the dimension and yaw angle, calculate the 3D coordinates of 3D BBox eight corners. The origin of the coordinate system if the object center.

param:
dims: object dimension represented by [h,w,l] ry: object yaw angle (rad)
Returns:numpy array of 3D coordinates with shape (3*8)
glimg.detbbox.project_corns_from_dims(dims, ry, locat, project_mat)[source]¶

Given the object’s dims and pose, as well as the projection matrix, calculate the projected coordinates of 8 global corners in image.

param:
dims: object dimension represented by [h,w,l] ry: object yaw angle (rad) locat: object location in world coordinate system (usually the camera coordinate system), represented as [x,y,z] project_mat: projection matrix in KITTI’s format. Shape (3*4), [:,0:3]: intrinsic, [:,3]: extrinsic
Returns:numpy array of 2D coordinates with shape (2*8)
glimg.detbbox.project_global_corns(global_corns, project_mat)[source]¶

Given the global corners and projection matrix of camera, calculate the projected coordinates of 8 global corners in image.

param:
global_corns: numpy array of 3D coordinates with shape (3*8) project_mat: projection matrix in KITTI’s format. Shape (3*4), [:,0:3]: intrinsic, [:,3]: extrinsic
Returns:numpy array of 2D coordinates with shape (2*8)
glimg.detbbox.ry_matrix(ry)[source]¶

get the rotation matrix for given yaw (rad)

param:
ry: yaw angle (rad)
Returns:rotation matrix
glimg.detbbox.xywh2xyxy(bbox)[source]¶

change bbox coord from [x,y,w,h] to [xmin,ymin,xmax,ymax]

param:
bbox: bounding represented by a list: [x,y,w,h]
Returns:bounding represented by a list: [xmin,ymin,xmax,ymax]
Return type:bbox
glimg.detbbox.xyxy2xywh(bbox)[source]¶

change bbox coord from [xmin,ymin,xmax,ymax] to [x,y,w,h]

param
bbox: bounding represented by a list: [xmin,ymin,xmax,ymax]
return
bbox: bounding represented by a list: [x,y,w,h]

glimg.transform module¶

glimg.transform.E2R(Ry, Rx, Rz)[source]¶

Combine Euler angles to the rotation matrix (right-hand)

Inputs:
Ry, Rx, Rz : rotation angles along y, x, z axis
only has Ry in the KITTI dataset
Returns:3 x 3 rotation matrix
glimg.transform.project_corns(corns, intrins)[source]¶

corns: 3*8 intrins: 3*4

return: 8*2
